name: Seven Oaks Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How this place is only a 3* hotel I do not know! My boyfriend and I had a superb stay here over Valentine's weekend, the staff are ever so friendly, helpful and efficient.
reviews.title: Cannot fault this charming hotel

reviews.text: The rooms very spacious and comfortable. There was a flat screen TV in the room with lots of channels. Bathroom large with a powerful, hot shower and plenty of toiletries provided. The hotel was quiet and we had 2 excellent night’s sleep in the comfortable, large bed. You could walk into the centre of town in about 10 minutes I’d say however we took taxis as it was raining which only cost about €5. The food was AMAZING! We had breakfast brought to our room both days and ate a meal in the restaurant, the portions were generous and the food very tasty indeed. The resident’s bar was open until quite late which was handy for a cheeky night cap! Remember to take your swimming stuff as the leisure centre is well worth a visit, very relaxing with once again friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Service was outstanding..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a fantastic hotel with excellent facilities and wonderful staff, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.
reviews.title: More than a three star hotel

reviews.text: A big thank you to the manager and staff - who exceeded themselves last week. I had to misfortune to have a flat tyre one of the mornings I stayed , the staff not only took me to my destination , they arranged the complete repair and replacement without me asking ..... Thanks you guys ....! Will be staying again .....
reviews.title: Best Place in Ireland

reviews.text: Food and service in the resturant fantastic, rooms excellent facilities were top class, loved everything especially the customer service all round
reviews.title: Excellent Venue

reviews.text: stayed in this hotel recently. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The rooms were dated but warm and comfortable. Bathroom very good with nice toiletries.
reviews.title: Decent hotel with friendly staff

reviews.text: My only complaint is that the bar food was a pricey for what you got. I am not referring to quantity here, but 'quality'. I had a fish dish which was very bland my partner had the trio of lamb, which was passable.
reviews.title: magic place

reviews.text: Apart from this, it is a decent hotel. Never tried the leisure facilities as only here one night on business in Carlow.
reviews.title: Diamond Jubilee Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Want to say from the moment we booked in to the time we left the service and and staff were wonderful . the food was 100% the pool was another 100% we had a great time all weekend .We were looked after very well. well donethe staff Thanks especially the lady in the bar who served us all weekend.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: A group of 14 celebrated a surprise Diamond Jubilee today May the 8th. It was a wonderful and memorable occassion. We had the use of a room to ourselves. This was very much appreciated by the group.(as we had not met for some time.)
reviews.title: Fantastic service
Excellent - First Class
reviews.text: We had a family reunion here over Easter Weekend and a better Hotel you could not find. The level of service and attenion was excellent. We really had an excelllent weekend. The staff are very helpful and friendly and cannot do enough to help and thats accross the board from reception to bar to restaurant to accommodation - a real credit to this property. the Food was very good in all area's and we did have bar food, Restaurant Dinner, Breakfast and attended a function - all without fault. Bedrooms are a good size and one of the few hotels still supplying the little extras like guest accessories in the bathrooms. The Leisure centre is top clas - great pool and gym area. All in all this hotel stands out. Good Value for Money, Excellent Service and comfortable to stay in. What more can one ask for.

We stayed at this great Carlow hotel over the EASTER weekend with over one hundred people in our family and friends reunion party. Allages from 1 to 95 were looked after. The food was great with very big portions (especially the home made mashed spuds!) but we had to wait to be seated for breakfast due to the large numbers - however the system they used to call your room worked well.There was another family reunion going on the same weekend and remarkably both large parties were well catered for!
reviews.title: Great food, friendly service and excellent pool with central Carlow location.
unpleasant
reviews.text: The sports/leisure club was clean, quiet and modern and free for residents. My sons could play ball games in the pool as long as they kept fabric swimming caps on, and there was a separate lane to swim in the pool for serious swimmers. The bars were a wee bit expensive paying €2.80 for a coke and almost €5 for a Guinness but the pint of stout was in good condition. Ample car parking for free at the side and back of the hotel, and the bedrooms were a good size allowing you to unpack easily. Hot water wasn't always available for a shower but you could link two rooms for a family of four at no extra charge which was very handy to give the kids independence/space.

The hotel staff were all very friendly and accommodating apart from the security guy who was unecessarily too officious in the bar at 2am when all were having great craic. He booted some teenagers out from our party without speaking to the parents first!
reviews.title: Excellent service & facilities at a good price.

reviews.text: far from town centre
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just been to the Seven Oaks for a night with my husband. We enjoyed it very much. Got a very nice welcome from Reception Staff and the room was fabulous. Nice friendly atmosphere from staff and everywhere was clean and welcoming. Will definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for a work do.
reviews.title: The place is a maze.

reviews.text: Good food and nice enough room.
reviews.title: Great hotel, made it a great weekend

reviews.text: The issue is trying to find the room.
reviews.title: This is worth a visit.

reviews.text: Two lifts and long walks.
reviews.title: Fantasic staff!!

description: Seven Oaks Hotel is one of the foremost hotels in Carlow and Leinster. From the moment you step into our magnificent reception area you will enjoy the warmest of Irish welcomes from our friendly staff, whose attention to your every need will ensure that you will want to return again and again. Carlow is now only 45 minutes from the M50 roundabout in Dublin. Conveniently located just 3 minutes walk from Carlow town centre, the Seven Oaks Hotel has long enjoyed an enviable reputation as one of the premier wedding and conferencing hotels in Carlow. A large private complimentary carpark, coupled with close proximity to the local bus/train station makes the the Seven Oaks Hotel an ideal place to stay.
